sets.name: Assault Vest
sets.description:
• Azumarill distinguishes itself as a Water-type with its access to Superpower, Fairy-type STAB moves, and priority Aqua Jet.
  • Superpower lets Assault Vest Azumarill defeat most Iron Bundle and most Magnezone.
  • Aqua Jet finishes off low health foes and allows Azumarill to outplay Disable users like Dragapult and Iron Valiant and Sturdy Pokemon like Magnezone and Counter Donphan.
  • The HP and Special Defense EVs, along with Assault Vest and a Careful nature, allow Azumarill to defeat Timid Choice Specs Iron Moth and non-Thunder Choice Specs Magnezone.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description:
• Superpower gives Azumarill good chances to defeat Speed-boosting Booster Energy Iron Bundle.
  • Aqua Jet OHKOes Iron Moth, while Fling lets Azumarill remove its Choice Band to avoid losing to Disable Dragapult.
  • The Special Defense investment, HP investment, and a Careful nature allow Azumarill to defeat most Iron Bundle.
  • Alternatively, an EV spread of 104 HP / 160 Atk / 244 Def with an Impish nature lets it defeat Chien-Pao, but this spread is less reliable versus Iron Bundle.

sets.name: Stall
sets.description:
• Chilling Water allows Azumarill to chip the foe down while reducing their Attack, giving it better chances versus Taunt Great Tusk.
  • Sap Sipper lures in Grass-types such as most offensive Choice Band Meowscarada.
  • The HP, Special Defense investment, and Calm nature allow Azumarill to defeat Timid Choice Specs Iron Valiant most of the time.
  • Use Charm or Amnesia to lower the foe's damage output until Azumarill is forced to use Rest.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description:
• Earthquake beats Bellibolt, Iron Moth, non-Air Balloon Iron Hands, and Sandy Shocks.
  • Gunk Shot beats most Sylveon sets, non-Encore + Disable Iron Valiant, and Azumarill.
  • Ice Shard is for Garchomp and Roaring Moon.
  • Head Smash OHKOes Talonflame and most Iron Bundle.
  • Play Rough beats Choice Band Annihilape and Choice Band Ting Lu.
  • Counter OHKOes Choice Band Slither Wing thanks to Donphan surviving an attack with Sturdy, as well as Attack Booster Energy Slither Wing if it doesn't use Bulk Up turn 1.
  • Donphan can also run an alternative spread of 32 HP / 248 Atk / 96 Def / 132 Spe with a Adamant Nature. The HP and Defense EVs allow Donphan to survive a hit from Mold Breaker Choice Band Haxorus and 2HKO it with Ice Shard. The Speed EVs allow Donphan to outspeed uninvested Skeledirge.
  • While using Head Smash beats non-Substitute Volcarona, using it against Substitute Volcarona can lead to Donphan losing, so it should use Earthquake instead.

sets.name: Endeavor
sets.description:
• Sturdy and Sitrus Berry allow Donphan to always get a Substitute up. This allows Donphan to beat Choice item Pokemon like Meowscarada and Chien-Pao, regardless of whether they go for an OHKO or not.
  • Earthquake is Donphan's strongest STAB move, beating Pokemon like Magnezone and Clodsire.
  • EVs are put into Attack and Defense to deal the most damage and help with physical attackers, since physical attacks rarely activate Sturdy.
  • 0 Speed IVs allow Donphan to be as slow as possible, which lets Substitute be used after slow threats like Dondozo and Garganacl move, creating a free turn to use Endeavor or Substitute again. 0 Special Defense IVs are used to activate Sturdy more often.
  • Donphan should almost always use Substitute turn 1. Donphan should continue to use it until its HP does not allow it to do so, proceeding to use Endeavor + Ice Shard to go for the KO.
  • An exception to this rule is that if Donphan can 2HKO with a combination Earthquake and Ice Shard, it should do that instead, such as against Choice item Dragapult, Magnezone, and Clodsire.

sets.name: Rocky Helmet
sets.description:
• Protect scouts Choice item users like Dragapult and Choice Specs Iron Bundle, leaving them open to Disable.

  • Encore handles setup Pokemon like Curse Dondozo as well as stall sets like Azumarill's.

  • Recover is especially useful against recoil move users like Talonflame and Arcanine.

  • Minimum Speed is run for opposing Sableye to guaranteed a slower Struggle.

  • Sableye should always use Protect turn one and then Encore against status moves or Disable against attacks. If Encore is used, the correct sequence is Encore > Protect > Disable > Encore and heal with Recover as necessary. Encore can also be used against weak attacks that have no chance of KOing Sableye. Sableye should also use Disable while the foe is using Struggle in order to conserve Recover's few PP against foes with Leftovers or other forms of recovery.

  • If Disable is used first, use Encore and Recover while the foe is stuck with Struggle. Since Recover has low PP, it should only be used when Sableye could faint to a critical hit.

sets.name: Trick + Disable
sets.description:
• Trick gives the foe Sableye's Choice Scarf, allowing Sableye to use Disable and force it into using Struggle. This allows Sableye to beat threats like Dondozo, Iron Hands, and Donphan.

  • Fling gets rid of any unwanted items, such as a given Assault Vest and Sableye's Choice Scarf.

  • Recover allows Sableye to heal off damage dealt while stalling its foe.

  • 252 HP and Defense EVs with an Impish nature maximize Sableye's physical bulk.

  • Sableye should almost always use Trick turn 1 and Disable turn 2, then repeatedly use Recover until the foe faints from Struggle recoil.

  • An exception to this is with Choice item Pokemon like Choice Band Dondozo and Donphan, where Sableye should use Fling turn 1 and Disable turn 2, then spam Recover.

  • Sableye struggles to beat Encore and Taunt users, like Annihilape and Skeledirge, and Pokemon that OHKO it, like Iron Valiant and Sylveon. Additionally, Sableye can not defeat Dark-types such as Meowscarada and Ting-Lu, due to its status moves not affecting them.

sets.name: Chilan Berry
sets.description:
• Chilan Berry helps Volcarona defeat Chien-Pao, non-Power Gem Meowscarada, and Slaking.
  • Will-O-Wisp helps Volcarona defeat Avalugg and non-Stone Edge Ting-Lu.
  • Substitute prevents Soak and Fake Tears from Bellibolt and Sylveon, respectively, as well as beating Choice Band Donphan if it uses Head Smash.
  • Morning Sun allows Volcarona to defeat specially defensive Sylveon.
  • Overheat allows Volcarona to defeat Sylveon as well as Steel-types like Corviknight, Magnezone, and Kingambit.
  • The HP and Defense EVs let Volcarona survive Throat Chop from Choice Band Chien-Pao, while the Speed EVs let it outspeed Adamant Annihilape.
  • Will-O-Wisp + Morning Sun lets Volcarona defeat Iron Hands, while Will-O-Wisp + Overheat lets it beat Avalugg.
  • Against Sylveon, Volcarona should use Quiver Dance once, then use Overheat twice.
  • Against Slaking, Volcarona should Quiver Dance twice, then use Bug Buzz.

sets.name: Passho Berry
sets.description:
• Passho Berry helps Volcarona defeat Iron Bundle.
  • Will-O-Wisp allows Volcarona to defeat Avalugg, non-Stone Edge Ting-Lu, and non-Head Smash Donphan.
  • Substitute prevents Soak and Fake Tears from Bellibolt and Sylveon, respectively, as well as beating Choice Band Donphan if it uses Head Smash.
  • Morning Sun allows Volcarona to defeat specially defensive Sylveon and Iron Hands in combination with Will-O-Wisp.
  • Overheat OHKOes Iron Bundle. It also defeats Steel-types like Corviknight, Magnezone, and Kingambit, as well as Sylveon and Avalugg in combination with Will-O-Wisp.
  • The EVs allow Volcarona to survive Hydro Pump from Modest Choice Specs Iron Bundle and Psyshock from Choice Specs Sylveon twice. The Speed EVs outspeed maximum Speed Corviknight, and the remaining EVs are put in Special Attack.
  • Against Espathra, Volcarona should use Bug Buzz turn 1, then Quiver Dance, then Bug Buzz again to secure the win.
  • Against Choice Specs Sylveon, Volcarona should use Quiver Dance once, then Overheat twice.
  • Against Kingambit and Magnezone, Volcarona should use Bug Buzz and then Overheat to avoid losing to Metal Burst and Mirror Coat.
  • Be aware of Choice Specs Meowscarada, as Power Gem can OHKO Volcarona.

sets.name: Babiri Berry
sets.description:
• Babiri Berry lets Sylveon survive Heavy Slam from Choice Band Great Tusk, Choice Band Iron Hands, and Choice Band Dondozo.
  • Hyper Voice allows Sylveon to bypass Substitute from Leech Seed Meowscarada, Dragapult, and Booster Energy Roaring Moon, and it's a spammable STAB option to beat Encore + Disable Iron Valiant.
  • Fake Tears is for non-Clear Amulet Bellibolt, maximizing Sylveon’s damage against it, and it synergizes with Calm Mind against non-Clear Amulet Espathra, non-Clear Amulet Dondozo, and Unaware Skeledirge.
  • The HP EVs let Sylveon survive two Hydro Pumps from Booster Energy Walking Wake by using Calm Mind. The Defense EVs let Sylveon survive Headlong Rush from Choice Band Great Tusk.

sets.name: Weakness Policy
sets.description:
• Charm helps Sylveon beat slower physical attackers like offensive Azumarill and Choice Band Ting-Lu.
  • Draining Kiss provides Sylveon enough recovery to beat Choice Band Donphan.
  • Fake Tears can be used to beat stall Azumarill, while Hyper Voice can be used to have a better matchup against Leech Seed Meowscarada.
  • The EVs allow Sylveon to outspeed Choice Band Donphan and survive its Gunk Shot twice by using Charm on turn 1, then using Draining Kiss twice to secure the win.
  • An alternate EV spread of 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 SpA with a Bold nature can be used to have the best possible odds against Choice Band Meowscarada. This set should also use Hyper Voice to reliably win against Leech Seed sets. However, this set loses against Donphan, and Choice Band Meowscarada's Giga Impact still has a slight chance to OHKO Sylveon. It's also unreliable against Ting-Lu, as Choice Band Ting-Lu can outspeed and beat it with Heavy Slam.

sets.name: Choice Specs
sets.description:
• Hyper Beam OHKOes Ting-Lu, Dondozo, non-Assault Vest Azumarill, and non-specially defensive Bellibolt.
  • Hyper Voice allows Sylveon to bypass Substitute from Leech Seed Meowscarada, Dragapult, and Petaya Berry Espathra. Hyper Voice also has perfect Accuracy and lets Sylveon beat slower Sylveon variants.
  • Psyshock allows Sylveon to beat Clodsire and occasionally Life Orb Salazzle.
  • Shadow Ball 2HKOes Skeledirge.
  • The Speed EVs are for Sylveon to outspeed Pokemon with 50 base Speed unless if they use a Speed boosting nature.
  • Against Espathra, Sylveon should always use Hyper Voice for the best chance to win against most Espathra. Unlike other Sylveon sets, Choice Specs loses to Encore + Disable Iron Valiant.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description:
• Outrage is Dragapult's strongest move. It can defeat foes like Meowscarada and deal great damage against neutral enemies, such as Arcanine and Bellibolt.
  • Dragon Darts handles foes that may use Haban Berry, like Salamence and Garchomp.
  • Phantom Force defeats some Ghost-types like Skeledirge.
  • U-turn defeats Booster Energy Brute Bonnet, unless it raises Attack with Booster Energy.
  • Infiltrator enables Dragapult to win against Espathra.
  • Clear Body allows Dragapult to win against stall Azumarill, bulky Salamence, and stall Arcanine.
  • Being Adamant enables Dragapult to defeat Air Balloon and Booster Energy Iron Hands, the latter if it raises Attack with Booster Energy.
  • If running Jolly, Dragapult can outspeed Booster Energy Iron Bundle if it does not raise its Speed with Booster Energy.
  • Usually Dragapult should use its strongest move against the foe, but in the Annihilape matchup, Dragapult can win against some sets if it uses Outrage on the first turn, instead of Phantom Force, and Annihilape uses Bulk Up.

sets.name: Choice Specs
sets.description:
• Neutral targets that lose to Dragapult's STAB attacks include non-Speed Booster Energy Iron Bundle, Meowscarada, Donphan, and Rotom-W.
  • Fire Blast OHKOes Scizor.
  • Hydro Pump is for non-Speed Booster Energy variants of Great Tusk, Iron Treads, and Sandy Shocks.
  • Thunderbolt is for non-Choice Band Dondozo and Corviknight.
  • Clear Body ensures that Dragapult's Special Attack isn't lowered by Bellibolt's Eerie Impulse. Infiltrator lets Dragapult bypass Substitute from Volcarona and Espathra.
  • Dragapult should try to avoid possible matchups against faster Pokemon such as Speed Booster Energy Walking Wake, and Iron Bundle and Choice Scarf Meowscarada, as their set versatility is high and potential matchups sometimes won't be in Dragapult's favor.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description:
• Flower Trick is for non-Choice Band Dondozo, Gastrodon, and non-Weakness Policy Ting-Lu.
  • Knock Off is for Espathra, Sableye, and Magnezone.
  • Giga Impact is for non-Chilan Berry Volcarona and offensive Sylveon.
  • Play Rough beats non-Counter Annihilape and Special Attack Booster Energy Walking Wake, while Thunder Punch beats Corviknight.
  • Trick and Shadow Claw can be used for matchups against Bellibolt and Counter Annihilape but are generally not too reliable, as Bellibolt can 2HKO Meowscarada with Thunder after Trick, while Annihilape can use Rage Fist to beat Shadow Claw Meowscarada instead of Counter.
  • Protean can force opponents to guess what move Meowscarada will use. For example, non-Choice Band Iron Hands has to choose between Close Combat and Wild Charge to beat either Flower Trick or Play Rough from Meowscarada. Choosing incorrectly, however, allows Meowscarada to 2HKO Iron Hands.
  • An Adamant nature allows Meowscarada to have a better chance to beat more defensive Sylveon sets and Iron Defense Corviknight. A Timid nature allows Meowscarada to outspeed Iron Moth, Hisuian Zoroark, and non-Speed Booster Energy Walking Wake.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description:
• Flower Trick OHKOes non-defensive Azumarill and Sandy Shocks and beats Rotom-W.
  • Knock Off OHKOes Dragapult and defeats Espathra, Iron Leaves, and non-Metal Burst Sableye.
  • Play Rough hits Iron Valiant, Roaring Moon, and opposing Meowscarada.
  • Low Kick OHKOes Chien-Pao, Tyranitar, and non-Chople Berry Kingambit.
  • Giga Impact OHKOes non-defensive Volcarona and Iron Moth.
  • Trick can potentially catch bulky Pokemon like Endeavor Donphan and Corviknight off guard by locking them into a useless move.
  • Choice Scarf Meowscarada should be used against fast and frail Pokemon it can OHKO with a super effective move, like Dragapult, Espathra, and Hisuian Zoroark, or Pokemon it can 2HKO and survive a hit from with Protean's type change, like Iron Valiant and Walking Wake.

sets.name: Choice Specs
sets.description:
• Frenzy Plant OHKOes Dondozo, Rotom-W, non-Sap Sipper Azumarill, and some Ting-Lu variants.
  • Dark Pulse beats most Espathra variants, beats non-Metal Burst Sableye, and has a high chance to OHKO Farigiraf.
  • Chilling Water 2HKOes Donphan and usually 2HKOes specially defensive Skeledirge. It also allows Meowscarada to transform into a Water-type and survive Torch Song and Blast Burn from Skeledirge.
  • Power Gem beats Volcarona, Torkoal, and non-Speed Booster Energy Iron Jugulis.
  • Pollen Puff OHKOes Iron Leaves, Wo-Chien, and opposing Meowscarada.
  • While using Dark Pulse beats most Prankster Sableye, using it against Metal Burst Sableye leads to Meowscarada losing, so it should use Frenzy Plant instead.

sets.name: SubSeed
sets.description:
• Alternating between Substitute and Protect after setting up Leech Seed allows Meowscarada to slowly gain HP if it is not OHKOed by the foe. It is a potent Speed trap, meaning most weaker, slower foes lose to it.
  • With Protean, Meowscarada can gain a more useful defensive typing, such as Normal, Water, or Fairy, for the entire battle.
  • Chilling Water allows Meowscarada to defeat Arcanine and Skeledirge.
  • Charm nets wins against non-Choice Band Iron Hands and Garchomp.
  • Mental Herb gives Meowscarada better matchups against Taunt users like Annihilape, Corviknight, and Kingambit, as well as Encore users like Gardevoir.
  • Alternatively, Chople Berry + Leaf Storm defeats most Great Tusk variants. After Protect, Chople Berry also comes in handy versus other Pokemon with Fighting-type coverage like Arcanine.
  • The Defense and HP investment allows Meowscarada to defeat Choice Band Donphan. With low HP investment, Meowscarada also gains relatively more from Leech Seed. Maximum Speed allows Meowscarada to set up Leech Seed against as many Pokemon as possible.
  • When using four status moves, use a Jolly nature to maximize Struggle damage. With Chilling Water or Leaf Storm, use a Timid nature instead.
  • Using Protect before using Leech Seed against the likes of Donphan and Talonflame allows Meowscarada to survive Gunk Shot, Brave Bird, and Flare Blitz.
  • Use Leech Seed turn 1 to stay a Grass-type against foes like Azumarill, Bellibolt, and Dondozo.
  • Use Taunt turn 1 to maintain positive matchups against Espathra and Prankster Sableye.

sets.name: Physically Defensive
sets.description:
• Will-O-Wisp burns physical attackers like Iron Hands, Great Tusk, and Annihilape.
  • Torch Song provides consistent damage while also ignoring Substitute, which helps versus Espathra, Volcarona, and Corviknight.
  • Encore shuts down slower Pokemon that use status moves like Soak Bellibolt and Fake Tears Sylveon. It also stops foes like Choice item Gardevoir and Choice Scarf Sableye from using Trick freely.
  • Blast Burn allows Skeledirge to OHKO threats like Iron Treads and Kingambit.
  • The investment in HP and Defense allows Skeledirge to survive Knock Off from Choice Band Meowscarada and Headlong Rush from Attack Booster Energy Great Tusk.
  • In combination with Weakness Policy, Blaze allows Skeledirge to OHKO Meowscarada after Meowscarada transforms into a Rock-type and uses Power Gem.
  • Unaware helps versus setup Pokemon like Bulk Up Annihilape, non-Lumina Crash Espathra, Volcarona, and Swords Dance Iron Hands.
  • Sitrus Berry helps against physical attackers and acts as insurance in case Will-O-Wisp misses against threats like Iron Hands.
  • Mental Herb is useful against opposing Encore users like Annihilape and Gardevoir.
  • Air Balloon is helpful against Ground-types like Great Tusk and Donphan.

sets.name: Mental Herb
sets.description:
• Thunder is used over Thunderbolt to 2HKO non-Choice item Iron Valiant.
  • Mental Herb helps Bellibolt defeat Taunt and Encore users, such as Iron Valiant and Annihilape.
  • The Speed EVs allow Bellibolt to outspeed uninvested base 60 Speed Pokemon like Magnezone and Sylveon.
  • Bellibolt should almost always use Soak first, followed by Parabolic Charge to recover and secure the win.
  • The HP EVs help Bellibolt against Modest Choice Specs Iron Valiant and the Defense EVs allow it to defeat Choice Band Meowscarada.
  • Against Choice Band Meowscarada, Bellibolt should use Soak turn 1 and Thunder turn 2 to avoid being 2HKOed by Flower Trick.
  • Against Speed Booster Energy Iron Valiant, Bellibolt should use Parabolic Charge turn 1 and Thunder turn 2 to avoid being locked into an unfavorable move by Encore.
  • Against Choice item Iron Valiant, Bellibolt should use Thunder turn 1 to OHKO it after Electromophosis activates.

sets.name: Clear Amulet
sets.description:
• Charge Beam helps with Calm Mind users such as Sylveon and Espathra in order to outdamage them and make progress while they boost their Special Defense, as well as against stall Corviknight if enough Special Attack boosts are obtained.
  • Slack Off provides recovery when needed in order to stall out Pokemon that have been weakened with Eerie Impulse, preventing them from being able to KO Bellibolt.
  • Clear Amulet prevents Special Defense drops from non-Choice Specs Sylveon with Fake Tears, Espathra with Lumina Crash, and Assault Vest Iron Moth with Acid Spray.
  • Against Sylveon, Bellibolt should always use Eerie Impulse first, making it impossible for Sylveon to KO if it tries to use Fake Tears thanks to the Clear Amulet. Choice Specs Sylveon Hyper Beam does not OHKO Bellibolt, and Hyper Voice does not 2HKO it after the Special Attack drop, which lets Bellibolt use Slack Off and Parabolic Charge freely in order to KO Sylveon.
  • Against Espathra, Bellibolt should either use Charge Beam first to counter Calm Mind from Weakness Policy or Clear Amulet sets, or it can use Parabolic Charge to break Substitute against Petaya Berry sets, as +6 Speed and +1 Special Attack Stored Power does not OHKO Bellibolt while the damage taken by Lumina Crash is mitigated by Parabolic Charge's recovery.

sets.name: Physically Defensive
sets.description:
• With Leftovers + Feather Dance + Roost, Espathra can surprise some physical attackers like Azumarill and Iron Hands.
  • With Weakness Policy + Reflect, Espathra can defeat Annihilape, which is unaffected by Feather Dance thanks to Defiant.
  • Calm Mind and Speed Boost allow Espathra to gradually gain a stronger Stored Power until it can OHKO or 2HKO the likes of Iron Valiant, Iron Hands, Iron Valiant, Azumarill, and Donphan.
  • Protect allows Espathra to gain Speed in order to use Calm Mind, Roost, or Stored Power before Iron Moth, Annihilape, Great Tusk, and Choice Specs Iron Bundle can move in subsequent turns.

sets.name: Clear Amulet
sets.description:
• Clear Amulet blocks the Special Defense drops from Sylveon's Fake Tears, Iron Moth's and Goodra's Acid Spray, and Magnezone's Metal Sound. Additionally, it also blocks the Special Attack drops from Bellibolt's Eerie Impulse and Walking Wake's Snarl.
  • Calm Mind + Roost lets Espathra outlast and beat Sylveon, Magnezone, and Timid Choice Specs or Modest non-Choice Specs Iron Moth.
  • Stored Power is the best damaging move for this set, as it pairs well with Calm Mind and Speed Boost to outdamage Bellibolt, Walking Wake, and Farigiraf. Clear Amulet prevents foes from lowering its power by removing Espathra's stat boosts.
  • Protect gives Espathra a more reliable matchup against Modest Choice Specs Iron Moth, while Feather Dance lets Espathra beat Choice Band Dondozo and Choice Band Donphan.
  • The general strategy with Clear Amulet Espathra is using the combination of Calm Mind, Protect or Feather Dance, and Speed Boost to increase Espathra's defensive capabilities, damage output, and Speed. Against Sylveon, for example, Espathra should use Calm Mind on the first turn and continue to use it until Espathra needs to use Roost, or until Stored Power will 2HKO Sylveon.
  • If running Protect, Espathra can use it on the first turn to procure a Speed boost. This, for example, is useful against Iron Moth, as Modest Choice Specs variants might OHKO with Overheat if Espathra can't use Calm Mind beforehand. After this, however, Espathra can return to its general strategy to KO Iron Moth with Stored Power.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description:
• Heavy Slam beats offensive Sylveon and Choice Band and mixed offense Iron Valiant.
  • Surf bypasses Counter from Choice Band Donphan while still beating Endeavor variants.
  • Avalanche is for Choice Band Meowscarada, while Outrage is for Walking Wake. Both moves, however, can be used to beat Garchomp, Goodra, and non-Disable Dragapult.
  • Water Veil prevents Dondozo from being hit by Will-O-Wisp from Skeledirge and Arcanine, while Unaware gives it a better matchup against Defense Booster Energy Great Tusk and some Espathra sets.
  • The HP and Defense EVs let Dondozo survive two Earthquakes from Choice Band Donphan. Maximum Attack EVs are used to maximize Dondozo's damage output. 0 Speed IVs and a Brave nature allow Dondozo to underspeed Endeavor Donphan and beat it with Surf.
  • An alternative EV spread of 104 HP / 252 Atk / 152 SpD with a Brave nature allows Dondozo to survive Energy Ball from Modest Choice Specs Iron Moth, which it can OHKO in return with Wave Crash.

sets.name: Stallbreaker
sets.description:
• Taunt denies any status moves from foes like Wo-Chien, forcing them into using their generally weak moves, Counter, or even Struggle.
  • Counter is able to deal massive amounts of damage to physical attackers, like Iron Hands and Choice Band users like Meowscarada, Great Tusk, and Dondozo.
  • Rage Fist can continue to get stronger during a match, even without having to use Bulk Up. In conjunction with Taunt, Annihilape can force Pokemon to attack it, boosting Rage Fist's Base Power.
  • Bulk Up lets Annihilape break past opposing setup sweepers like Swords Dance Iron Hands. Close Combat can be used against the Normal- and Dark-types that are immune to or resist Rage Fist, such as Slaking, Ting-Lu, and Kingambit.
  • The HP and Defense EVs ensure Annihilape isn't 2HKOed by Choice Band variants of Dondozo and Meowscarada. Alternatively, you can run 92 HP / 252 Def / 164 Spe to outspeed Pressure stall Corviknight; it has significantly less overall bulk, however.
  • Against Dondozo, use Taunt turn 1 to stop Curse sets and then use Counter. This allows for Annihilape to beat both Curse and Choice Band Dondozo. Sitrus Berry ensures Annihilape isn't 2HKOed by Dondozo's Wave Crash.

sets.name: Specially Defensive Weakness Policy
sets.description:
• Gunk Shot is for non-Choice Specs Sylveon and Choice Specs Iron Valiant.
  • Encore can deter Skeledirge's and Arcanine's Will-O-Wisp and Iron Hands's Swords Dance due to the threat of them being permanently locked into those moves. It also can be used against Trick from Choice Specs Iron Valiant and Choice Scarf Rotom-W.
  • Screech is for Unaware Dondozo, while Bulk Up lets Annihilape beat Booster Energy Iron Hands.
  • The EV spread gives Annihilape the best odds to survive Choice Specs Iron Valiant's Moonblast. The remaining EVs, which would not help with this, are invested in Speed.
  • Gunk Shot is Annihilape's best option against Choice Specs Iron Valiant. Annihilape needs to choose between Encore and Gunk Shot on the first turn, as Encore counters Iron Valiant's Trick, while Gunk Shot beats Iron Valiant's Moonblast. However, selecting the wrong move can lead to Iron Valiant 2HKOing Annihilape with Moonblast or causing Annihilape to use Struggle after using Disable on Annihilape's Gunk Shot.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description:
• Gunk Shot helps Annihilape beat Fairy-types such as Sylveon and Azumarill.

  • Shadow Claw is helpful for dealing immediate damage to Volcarona and Bulk Up Annihilape.

  • Phantom Force can also be run in order to beat common Protect users like Gardevoir and some Espathra variants.

  • Close Combat is Annihilape's strongest STAB move, letting it dent Corviknight.

  • Drain Punch prevents Annihilape from lowering its defensive stats versus Substitute users like Speed Booster Energy Roaring Moon.

  • Outrage beats Dragon-types like Goodra, most Haxorus variants, and Walking Wake.

  • Seed Bomb, Fire Punch, Earthquake, and Counter can be used over Outrage but are generally considered worse moves, as they only hit a limited number of Pokemon, like Gastrodon, Scizor, Clodsire, and Iron Hands, respectively.

  • The Special Defense EVs allow Annihilape to survive one Hydro Pump from Modest Choice Specs Iron Bundle.

  • Against most foes, use the attack that will deal the most damage. It is important to note Weakness Policy users like Magnezone, which Annihilape should not use super effective attacks against to avoid activating its item.

sets.name: Roseli Berry
sets.description:
• Defiant lets Annihilape counter stat-lowering strategies, such as Arcanine's Intimidate and Azumarill's Charm.

  • Roseli Berry lets Annihilape beat Fairy-types that it usually struggles or outright can't win against, such as Sylveon and Azumarill, along with Pokemon with Fairy coverage such as Play Rough + Choice Band Meowscarada.

  • Bulk Up allows Annihilape to survive longer and boost Rage Fist's power, both by boosting Attack and taking hits, in front of foes such as Donphan.

  • Gunk Shot is Annihilape's strongest move against most Fairy-types, such as Azumarill and Sylveon.

  • Drain Punch nails Dark-types, such as Ting-Lu and Chien-Pao, alongside giving recovery against foes such as Donphan and Weakness Policy Ting-Lu.

  • Counter can OHKO physical attackers Annihilape cannot damage easily, such as non-Swords Dance Iron Hands and Azumarill.

  • Taunt and Encore are both used to disrupt various strategies. Taunt is better in denying offensive setup from foes, like opposing Annihilape, and blocking slower Taunt or Encore users such as uninvested Corviknight and Donphan. Encore better punishes defensive setup, such as Garganacl's Iron Defense and stall Arcanine.

  • Annihilape's last moveslot comes with a lot of opportunity costs. Removing Drain Punch gives harder matchups against Dark-types like Ting-Lu. Not slotting Counter forces it to hit physical Fairy-types like Azumarill and Play Rough Meowscarada with Gunk Shot, which has lower accuracy.

  • The HP and Special Defense investment with a Careful nature allows Annihilape to survive a Hyper Beam from Modest Choice Specs Sylveon. 116 Attack EVs let it 2HKO most Sylveon variants with Gunk Shot turn 1 and Rage Fist turn 2, minimizing miss chances. The remaining EVs are put in Speed to outspeed Modest Sylveon and Modest Magnezone.

  • Annihilape struggles to deal with faster Pokemon with super effective STAB moves like Talonflame, most Dragapult variants, and faster Taunt users such as Booster Energy Great Tusk and Corviknight.

sets.name: Booster Energy (Speed)
sets.description:
• Bulk Up further boosts Great Tusk's naturally high Attack and Defense stats.
  • Booster Energy lets Great Tusk outspeed Meowscarada, Annihilape, and Corviknight.
  • Knock Off can be used to remove Choice items from Dragapult, Gholdengo, and Magnezone.
  • Great Tusk’s EV spread allows for maximum Attack while still procuring the Speed boost from its Booster Energy. The HP investment increases Great Tusk's bulk and ensures its HP remains odd to have a better matchup against Leech Seed.
  • Due to Great Tusk's low Special Defense stat, it's weak to bulky special attackers such as Weakness Policy or Air Balloon Gholdengo and Skeledirge.
  • Great Tusk is strong against Pokemon that it is able to outspeed due to Booster Energy and should use a damaging move against Choice Specs Iron Bundle, Meowscarada, and Chien Pao.

sets.name: Attack Booster
sets.description:
• Bulk Up allows Great Tusk to reliably beat Choice Band Iron Hands and Choice Band Annihilape. When combined with Taunt, Bulk Up gives Great Tusk a reliable matchup into common Annihilape sets, as the moves work together to disallow Annihilape's own Bulk Up + Taunt combination while playing around Annihilape's Rage Fist and Counter.
  • Close Combat lets Great Tusk reliably beat Slaking, while Knock Off is useful to beat Choice item Magnezone.
  • The Defense EVs let Great Tusk survive Jolly Choice Band Slaking's Giga Impact, while the Speed EVs let it outspeed Adamant Choice Band Slaking.
  • Against non-Air Balloon Skeledirge, Great Tusk has a choice to use either Headlong Rush or Taunt. Headlong Rush OHKOes most Skeledirge sets, like Mental Herb Skeledirge, but has a low chance to OHKO defensive Weakness Policy Skeledirge, which can OHKO in return with Weakness Policy-boosted Blast Burn. However, if Skeledirge uses Will-O-Wisp, Great Tusk's Headlong Rush 2HKOes it. Great Tusk can use Taunt to stop Skeledirge's Will-O-Wisp, but this loses to Skeledirge's Torch Song.
  • If Air Balloon Skeledirge uses Will-O-Wisp on the first turn, Great Tusk has to correctly predict this and use Taunt to win. If Skeledirge does not use Will-O-Wisp, Great Tusk can use Knock Off into Headlong Rush to win. However, if Air Balloon Skeledirge uses Torch Song on the first turn while Great Tusk uses Taunt, Skeledirge would win.
  • Against Magnezone, Great Tusk can use Knock Off into Headlong Rush to play around Choice Specs Magnezone's Hyper Beam.
  • If using Knock Off over Close Combat, Great Tusk should use Headlong Rush twice to 2HKO Jolly Choice Band Slaking; however, against Adamant Choice Band Slaking, Great Tusk should use Bulk Up followed by Headlong Rush twice to win.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description:
• With maximum Attack and Speed EVs and Choice Scarf, Great Tusk can outspeed and OHKO Meowscarada, non-Speed Booster Energy Iron Bundle, and Chien-Pao.
  • Megahorn is for Brute Bonnet and some Wo-Chien
  • Fire Fang is for Scizor.
  • Head Smash is for Volcarona and Iron Jugulis.
  • Heavy Slam is for some Sylveon.
  • Due to Great Tusk's low Special Defense, it is weak to special attackers like Skeledirge, Speed Booster Energy Iron Bundle, Babiri Berry Sylveon, and Iron Valiant.
  • Since Great Tusk will be locked into an attacking move, opposing Annihilape can set up with Bulk Up and OHKO Great Tusk afterwards.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description:
• Heavy Slam is likely to OHKO non-Babiri Berry defensive Sylveon.
  • Head Smash OHKOes Stall Talonflame, Choice Scarf Meowscarada, and bulky Volcarona. However, other variants of these Pokemon can still beat Choice Band Great Tusk.
  • Knock Off 2HKOes non-bulky Magnezone while removing its item as well as OHKOing Farigiraf.
  • Megahorn OHKOes Iron Leaves and non-Protect Espathra.
  • Ice Spinner OHKOs Garchomp and non-defensive Substitute Roaring Moon so Great Tusk need not risk lowering its Defense from hitting Substitute with Close Combat. However, this will lose against defensive Roaring Moon that use Acrobatics turn 1.
  • Using a Jolly nature allows Great Tusk to outspeed and OHKO non-Choice Scarf Gardevoir and Adamant Slaking. Adamant allows it to reliably OHKO non-Babiri Berry defensive Sylveon with Heavy Slam, have a high chance to OHKO non-defensive Azumarill and Scizor with Headlong Rush, and occasionally OHKO Air Balloon Skeledirge with Head Smash.

sets.name: Choice Specs
sets.description:
• Hydro Pump OHKOes Skeledirge, Arcanine, non-Passho Berry Volcarona, non-Assault Vest Iron Moth, Iron Treads, and physically defensive Espathra.
  • Freeze-Dry beats Dondozo and non-Speed Booster Energy Walking Wake.
  • Blizzard OHKOes non-Assault Vest Iron Leaves and Wo-Chien.
  • Hyper Beam OHKOes opposing Iron Bundle.
  • Iron Bundle can run an alternative EV spread of 232 HP / 68 Def / 160 SpA / 48 Spe with a Timid Nature. The HP and Defense EVs allow Iron Bundle to live a Giga Impact from Choice Band Slaking after Chilling Water. The Speed EVs allow Iron Bundle to outspeed Iron Moth and Adamant Meowscarada.
  • While Ice Beam has a high chance to beat non-specially defensive Pressure stall Corviknight, if you are sure that Corviknight is a specially defensive Pressure stall set, you can attempt to use Hydro Pump to win, but this is not reliable.

sets.name: Choice Specs
sets.description:
• Overheat beats Iron Hands and Corviknight.
  • Sludge Wave OHKOes Sylveon and Gardevoir.
  • Bug Buzz OHKOes non-specially defensive Espathra.
  • Dazzling Gleam with a Timid nature OHKOes non-Choice Scarf Haxorus, while Hurricane with a Modest nature 2HKOes specially defensive Skeledirge.
  • A Timid nature allows Iron Moth to outspeed and OHKO non-Speed Booster Energy Sandy Shocks and Choice Band Iron Treads with Overheat. A Modest nature allows it to reliably beat non-Assault Vest Annihilape with Overheat.
  • Overheat is better to use against Annihilape because Iron Moth isn't OHKOed back by Rage Fist from specially defensive Weakness Policy Annihilape; however, against Assault Vest Annihilape, Iron Moth loses unless it uses Hurricane.

sets.name: Weakness Policy
sets.description: This EV spread survives Choice Band Hisuian Avalugg's Avalanche and Timid Choice Specs Iron Bundle's Hydro Pump; the remaining EVs are invested in Attack.

sets.name: Encore + Disable
sets.description:
• Protect allows Iron Valiant to scout the moves used before using Encore and Disable as well as being able to beat Slaking.
  • Encore and Disable can be used in tandem with each other to force foes to Struggle. Generally, Iron Valiant will use Protect, Encore, Protect, Disable, and Encore in that order to ensure your opponent cannot attack. Against choice locked targets like Choice Specs Sylveon and Choice item Rotom-W, use Protect turn 1 followed by Disable.
  • Moonblast is a stronger and more free to use STAB option that hits Annihilape, Sableye, and Dragapult. Aura Sphere is weaker but allows it to hit Iron Bundle, Magnezone, and Arcanine for more damage.
  • The Defense EVs allow Iron Valiant to take more hits from Struggle, while the Speed EVs and Booster Energy allow it to outspeed Dragapult.
  • You should generally avoid possible matchups against faster Speed Booster Pokemon like Iron Bundle and Walking Wake or Choice Scarf users like Meowscarada; while they can't guarantee an OHKO, neither can Iron Valiant with Moonblast.
  • Knowing when to use Moonblast is also key information. Some Pokemon, like Dragapult, can take advantage of Iron Valiant using Protect turn 1. Against Dragapult and opposing Iron Valiant, Iron Valiant should always use Moonblast turn 1 for the best chances of winning.
  • If Iron Valiant locks the foe into a weak move or status move with Encore, do not use Disable, as you can repeat the Encore later on or go for the KO with Moonblast or Aura Sphere.

sets.name: Choice Specs
sets.description:
• Psyshock hits Iron Moth and Clodsire.
  • Thunderbolt hits Corviknight, while Grass Knot is able to OHKO Dondozo.
  • Trick + Disable can reliably beat Weakness Policy Ting-Lu, Clodsire, and non-Mental Herb Corviknight.
  • Against Espathra, Iron Valiant should always use Moonblast for the best chance of winning. Moonblast has a favorable chance to OHKO non-specially defensive variants, which win if they use Calm Mind.
  • If running Trick + Disable, you should be cautious of Skeledirge and Bellibolt because they can beat Iron Valiant after Trick gives them Choice Specs.

sets.name: Special Attack Booster Energy
sets.description:
• Flamethrower beats Corviknight and non-Assault Vest Iron Leaves.
  • The HP and Defense EVs allow Walking Wake to survive a hit from Adamant Choice Band Great Tusk, the Special Defense EVs allow Walking Wake to survive Dazzling Gleam from Modest Choice Specs Iron Moth, and the Speed EVs allow Walking Wake to outspeed maximum Speed Corviknight.
  • After using Aqua Jet, Special Attack Booster Energy Walking Wake beats Magnezone and Avalugg with Flamethrower while avoiding being KOed by Mirror Coat.
  • Walking Wake 2HKOes Donphan and Assault Vest Iron Moth by using Aqua Jet after Hydro Pump, and it OHKOes non-specially defensive Sableye by alternating between Hydro Pump and Draco Meteor to OHKO and avoid Sableye's Disable.

sets.name: Speed Booster Energy
sets.description:
• Snarl beats non-Clear Amulet Espathra and Farigiraf.
  • Flamethrower beats Scizor, as well as non-Weakness Policy Magnezone after using Snarl.
  • Hurricane beats Iron Valiant, Slither Wing, and most Meowscarada.
  • Speed Booster Energy allows Walking Wake to outspeed and OHKO Great Tusk, Haxorus, Dragapult, non-Speed Booster Energy Iron Bundle, and Garchomp.
  • 244 Special Attack EVs allow Walking Wake to maximize its Special Attack while also getting the Speed boost from Booster Energy.
  • Walking Wake should use Snarl twice against non-Choice Specs Magnezone and then use Flamethrower to ensure that it does not lose to Weakness Policy Magnezone.
